meanings.definition: To make (something) worldwide in scope or application.
meanings.sent1: Companies often globalise their products to reach more customers.
meanings.sent2: The internet has helped globalise communication across the globe.
meanings.sent3: When the superhero used their powers, they were able to globalise their influence.
meanings.sent4: The idea of peace can globalise and spread like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The mission is to globalise awareness about environmental issues.

meanings.definition: To extend to all parts of the world.
meanings.sent1: The pandemic quickly globalised and affected every continent.
meanings.sent2: The news of the discovery globalised within hours.
meanings.sent3: The rumor about the new student globalised around the school.
meanings.sent4: The music festival aims to globalise its reach to music lovers worldwide.
meanings.sent5: The trend of sustainability is starting to globalise in various industries.

meanings.definition: To integrate (something) on a global scale.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to globalise its supply chain for efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The organization's goal is to globalise its humanitarian efforts.
meanings.sent3: The chef's recipe was so delicious that it globalised quickly among food enthusiasts.
meanings.sent4: The artist's work has the potential to globalise cultural appreciation.
meanings.sent5: The initiative aims to globalise access to education for all children.
